settings.title: PRP THERAPY
settings.info:
Platelet Rich Plasma (PRP) therapy has been FDA approved and utilized for over 30 years for advanced wound healing. Now, we are seeing exciting results with Platelet Rich Plasma treatment for hair growth and anti-aging of the face. A patient’s blood is drawn and spun in a centrifuge to concentrate the platelets to a specific concentration effective for hair growth. Dr. Yates uses a specialized centrifuge that consistently gives concentrations of platelets at 4-7% of normal blood count. 
"Not all PRP is created equal"
The platelets are then activated and injected back into the scalp at the level of the hair follicles. This process stimulates the body’s own growth factors and stem cells to slow hair loss, reverse miniaturized hair to produce a strong, visible hair again, and if used at the time of a hair transplant, it encourages faster graft growth. This has been very effective for both men and women.

See more information:

  • PRP Treatments for Hair Loss
  • PRP FAQ’s
  • Instructions before PRP Treatment

settings.text: Platelet Rich Plasma therapy is derived from the patient’s own blood serum. The patient’s blood is placed in a centrifuge where each part of the blood is separated. The platelet rich plasma is isolated and used to inject into the patient’s scalp. This PRP therapy is rich in growth factors, multiple other wound healing and new hair follicle stimulating cells. PRP has long been used for enhanced wound healing and joint restoration but has now been found to actually stimulate new hair growth. This therapy can be used in conjunction with the surgical hair restoration procedures or alone for patients electing not to have surgery. Non-surgically, several studies have shown increased hair density at 4 months lasting for approximately 11 months. Non-surgical injections of PRP are generally performed twice a year.

Concentrated platelets delivered directly to the weakened hair follicle begin our body’s natural healing process by signaling growth factors and stem cells to the area. They immediately go to work to rejuvenate the hair follicle and hair growth. Yates Hair Science Group has been using PRP treatments to help restore hair for over 8 years. Dr. Yates is a key opinion leader for Harvest Technologies and trains other doctors to perform PRP treatments. We continue to be excited and encouraged by the results our patients, men and women, experience from PRP and Stem Cell Therapy treatments.

settings.title: WHAT HAIR LOSS CONDITIONS CAN BE TREATED WITH PRP?
settings.text:
Many PRP clinics recommend 3-6 treatments. With our superior centrifuge system, we see results after one treatment. The key is the concentration of platelets obtained and the ability to inject actual PlateletRICHPlasma instead of the PlateletPOORPlasma widely offered.

  • Androgenetic Alopecia/ Male Pattern Baldness
  • Alopecia Areata/ Spot Baldness
  • Feminine Androgenetic Alopecia/ Female Pattern Baldness
  • Many other conditions resulting in hair loss
